title: In bombarded Kherson: 'I will stay until the end, even if I have to freeze to death'
description: Since evacuating Kherson, the Russian army has been relentlessly shelling the Ukranian city, specifically targeting energy infrastructure in order to plunge its remaining residents into darkness and despair.

title: Messi leads Argentina into quarterfinals with 2-1 over Australia
description: Lionel Messi marked his 1,000th professional game with his first goal in the knockout stage of a World Cup in a victory over Australia; will play Netherlands in the quarterfinals.

title: Netherlands eliminates US 3-1 to advance to World Cup quarterfinals
description: In a disappointing end for the US team who had hoped to advance past the Round of 16, the Dutch took the lead in the first half, earning their place in the quarterfinals.

title: Virtual creations are already a reality in fashion school classrooms
description: Students can now train in metaverse-style design at recognized institutions in the sector.

title: Kanye West praises Hitler and embarrasses the Republican Party
description: The rapper's presence, a few days earlier, at a dinner at Donald Trump's home along with the white supremacist Nick Fuentes, had already caused a stir among Conservatives.

title: UK arrests wealthy Russian in London raid, as police crack down on Putin enablers
description: Authorities arrested the unnamed businessman on suspicion of money laundering, conspiracy to commit perjury and conspiracy to defraud the Home Office.

title: Emmanuel Macron's unexpected conversation with Elon Musk in New Orleans
description: The French president concluded his American tour in Louisiana, where he presented an initiative promoting the French language. He also met with Twitter's new boss.

title: UK, Greece in 'advanced stage' of 'secret talks' over return of Parthenon Marbles
description: The British Museum and Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis have been holding behind-the-scene talks about the reunification of the ancient sculptures, an Athens daily newspaper reported.

title: Air France and easyJet threatened by strikes during the holiday season
description: Unions of the two leading airlines operating in France are threatening to disrupt traffic during a crucial period of activity in the sector.

title: Russia owns the only plant in the world capable of reprocessing spent uranium
description: The war in Ukraine has put into question the future of the reprocessing sector.

title: Russian nuclear energy, the industry that has gone unsanctioned by the West
description: The Russian nuclear industry is essential for the operation of many power plants in Europe.

title: World Cup 2022: Before hosting the 2026 World Cup, the US takes the lead in North American football
description: Of the three co-hosts of the next World Cup, only the United States will play the Round of 16 in Qatar on Saturday against the Netherlands. Mexico had a disappointing elimination, while Canada lost all three of its games.

title: How emojis became a political language of symbols
description: These yellow pictograms have proliferated and diversified to the point of becoming an indispensable part of our digital communication.

title: Beijing, Shenzhen will no longer require Covid-19 tests for public transport
description: This slight easing of Covid-19 restrictions follows weekend protests across the country by residents frustrated by China’s draconian 'zero-Covid' policy, in place since the start of the pandemic.

title: In the Netherlands, Esther Ouwehand and her very popular Party for Animals
description: Initially derided and dismissed, this unusual political party is now running neck and neck with the Christian Democrats and the environmentalists.

title: Virunga Park once again at the heart of conflicts in the eastern DRC
description: The resurgence of the March 23 Movement rebellion is taking place in Africa's oldest reserve, where the last mountain gorillas live.

title: France is on a knife edge over possible power cuts
description: On Thursday, the French government announced possible 'rotating load shedding' from January 2023, which would affect 60% of the population.

title: Covid-19: In France, a fall vaccine booster campaign is unconvincing
description: Despite surges in infections and hospitalizations, only 9.4% of the over-80s and 7.2% of the 60-80s had received a new shot since October 3. The trivialization of Covid-19 and the lack of clear government messaging are to blame.

title: 'Not going to the gas station anymore changed my life:' France's rural residents are converting to electric cars
description: The electric car has become an attractive alternative to those fueled by an internal combustion engine. Converts say they are caught between the burden of increasing electricity bills and environmental concerns.

title: Back on trial, Harvey Weinstein faces an additional 60 years in prison
description: Already sentenced, in New York in 2020, to 23 years in prison, the former Hollywood producer is accused of sexual assault by four women in a Los Angeles court.

title: 'How can we repair the irreparable?': Assessing compensation for French church sexual abuse victims
description: The CRR and INIRR are responsible for assessing, on a case-by-case basis, the cost of victims' shattered lives. They use a restorative justice approach given that criminal justice is not possible.

title: Emmanuel Macron visits New Orleans to reinforce cultural connection and discuss climate change
description: During his visit to the Bayou state, the French president also had a 'clear and honest' conversation with Twitter boss Elon Musk focused on content moderation.

title: G7 and EU agree to $60 oil price cap to stifle Russia's 'war machine'
description: The price cap aims to reorder the global oil market to prevent price spikes and starve President Vladimir Putin of funding for his war in Ukraine.
